meanings.definition: To break down food in the stomach and intestines for absorption into the body.
meanings.sent1: After eating, my body starts digesting the food to get energy.
meanings.sent2: The enzymes in the stomach help in digesting the food we eat.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my stomach ever gets tired of digesting all the food I eat.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a machine, constantly digesting new information.
meanings.sent5: The process of digesting food is essential for our survival.

meanings.sent1: It takes time for students to digest complex concepts in math.
meanings.sent2: She was still digesting the news of her promotion at work.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe how quickly he can digest and remember all the details.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a sponge, always digesting new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Digesting new ideas can sometimes be challenging but rewarding.

meanings.definition: To think over or ponder something.
meanings.sent1: I need some time to digest what you just told me.
meanings.sent2: He sat quietly, digesting the implications of his decision.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how long he can digest a single thought.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a library, constantly digesting new ideas.
meanings.sent5: Digesting a problem before jumping into a solution is wise.
